subject: Regarding Product Warranty and Pedal Modification
description_text:
I am writing about the warranty for my pedals, the Simsonn plus x P3-H3.

Currently, I don't really enjoy brake feel during casual, non-racing use.

I am considering a modification to improve the feel to my liking,
specifically regarding the spare clutch springs. I believe they would fit
perfectly with either a 28mm rubber damper or by using the spring alone
.
Before proceeding, I would like to confirm if this modification would void
the warranty on the pedals themselves. My primary concern is maintaining
the warranty for the main pedal set; the warranty on the accessories is a
lower priority for me.

Could you please advise if making this change is permissible under the
terms of the warranty?

Thank you for your time and assistance.

conversations.body_text: Hi kkt nwm,  We will continue to provide warranty coverage even after you replace or modify the springs, so please rest assured. However, the choice of damping must be matched with the appropriate force level, otherwise improper damping could cause damage.Â
